column4: hey all, i seem to have lost smart tab completion and colours in the terminal? any ideas?
You might have accidentially switched your shell from bash to sh.
how do i know if i use bash 4?
Ctrl-X, Ctrl-V will show you the version (if it's bash)
exec bash didnt do anything either
But I'm using bash4 on Arch, it works just fine
Press Ctrl-X Ctrl-V, does it say anything?
So it's still bash. Try 'source ~/.profile' and see if that brings prompt back.
ah i think i know what happened
i accidently ran rm -rf /home the other day thinking i was in a ssh server on another server
some of the . files are missing

/etc/skel contains the "skeleton" profile, the same all new users get - so copy and chown.
